gitlabTokenLabel.description: Label for the GitLab token input.

gitlabTokenPlaceholder.message: Required for private repos and higher API limits
gitlabTokenPlaceholder.description: Placeholder for the GitLab token input.

gitlabTokenTooltip.message:
Why add a GitLab token?
Scrum Helper works without a GitLab token for public repositories, but adding a personal access token is recommended for a better experience. It raises your API limits, allows access to private repos (if permitted), and improves accuracy and speed. Tokens are stored locally in your browser and never sent to us. The token persists across browser sessions.

How to obtain:
1. Go to GitLab Access Tokens.
2. Click "Add new token"
3. Select scopes: read_api, read_user
4. Click "Create personal access token"
5. Copy and paste it here.
Keep your token secret!
gitlabTokenTooltip.description: Tooltip for the GitLab token input explaining how to obtain a token.
